result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Jerome Beach was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nicholas Jerome Beach is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nicholas Jerome Beach was found guilty of Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1 and 2.
Defendant to report to Probation November 4, 2014.

  
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA: Kenneth N. Sortedahl, DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski, DF:  Nicholas Jerome Beach appeared from jail. Includes 14CF148, 14CF322, 14CF420 and 14CF443. 

There is an agreement on file 14CF148. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count 3 in 14CF148. Def pleads no contest. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates def guilty of count 3. Court dismisses counts 1 & 2.  Court orders 

S/W - 1 year probation (Count 3 on 14CF148) with conditions:
- Restitution, to be determined within 30 days and payable through probation. 
- Court costs $243.00; payable through probation.
- Follow all rules and regulations of probation. 
Defendant advised of right to appeal.

Per SRN 6/26/14 - Faxed Dispatch and Sheriff.  eif
Pre-trial conference on July 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.

$250.00 bond on file.

 and _X_ SIGNATURE BOND:   _X_ Defendant guarantees compliance with the terms of this bond by pledging $2500.00 and understands that if the defendant does not comply with the terms of this bond, the bond will be forfeited and the defendant and/or surety may be ordered to pay the amount of the bond.

  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Jenkins Home Services or Mark Jenkins.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: SRN, RPR: Vicki Kasten, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Alexis S Mckinley,  DF ATTY:  Joshua Hargrove for John A Kucinski,  DF:  Nicholas Jerome Beach appeared from jail. Court confirms address. Court questions Defendant.  QUASH WARRANT.  ADA McKinley asks for an additional $250.00 bond.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 7, 2014 at 10:30 am.
